elements.2211.03181_7057132f1f5ba9a791bf3d4ae079e: Principal component analysis (PCA) is a standard dimensionality reduction technique used in various research and applied fields
elements.2211.03181_6a3ebef72d4cbcbd8c16482634a98: From an algorithmic point of view, classical PCA can be formulated in terms of operations on a multivariate Gaussian likelihood
elements.2211.03181_adda3fad0deed4f47f763eebf4bd2: As a consequence of the implied Gaussian formulation, the principal components are not robust to outliers
elements.2211.03181_ca1aa1aa758b5e193c985f200821a: In this paper, we propose a modified formulation, based on the use of a multivariate Cauchy likelihood instead of the Gaussian likelihood, which has the effect of robustifying the principal components
elements.2211.03181_37b9b530033ee065e583b64dfb665: We present an algorithm to compute these robustified principal components
elements.2211.03181_b680ad8daaa2b8255641ae77fbcba: We additionally derive the relevant influence function of the first component and examine its theoretical properties
elements.2211.03181_be11443114297338cab11e5affccf: Simulation experiments on high-dimensional datasets demonstrate that the estimated principal components based on the Cauchy likelihood outperform or are on par with existing robust PCA techniques.
elements.2211.03181_7febe4a83151563e869b733881229: In the analysis of multivariate data, it is frequently desirable to employ statistical methods which are insensitive to the presence of outliers in the sample
elements.2211.03181_50e8f326db69a172d206f1ecffb24: To address the problem of outliers, it is important to develop robust statistical procedures
elements.2211.03181_9eac779349337b5815b634e30ba35: Most statistical procedures include explicit or implicit prior assumptions about the distribution of the observations, but often without taking into account the effect of outliers
elements.2211.03181_453748a240dcfd4432f473f49e354: The purpose of this paper is to present a novel robust version of PCA which has some attractive features.
elements.2211.03181_e49c856e534b553d065f1aeb1f5c0: Principal components analysis (PCA) is considered to be one of the most important techniques in statistics
elements.2211.03181_35d6dc91b8d7ac4fa5cc154bd5f98: However, the classical version of PCA depends on either a covariance or a correlation matrix, both of which are very sensitive to outliers
elements.2211.03181_955a6fcf347e5ac5c2d1ec0d8a3ca: We develop an alternative method to classical PCA, which is far more robust, by using a multivariate Cauchy likelihood to construct a robust principal components (PC) procedure
elements.2211.03181_d5d33eb92f980baf31e775e7206e8: It is an adaptation of the classic method of PCA obtained by replacing the Gaussian log-likelihood function by the Cauchy log-likelihood function, in a sense that will be explained in section
elements.2211.03181_19a97dcda45ba8d4a927f7d3345f3: Although we do not claim that the interpretation of standard PCA in terms of operations on a Gaussian likelihood is new, see Bolton and Krzanowski, this fact does not appear to have been exploited in the development of a robust PCA procedure, as we do in this paper
elements.2211.03181_4fccaf108c59722490c95eb846412: An important reason for using the multivariate Cauchy likelihood is that this likelihood has only one maximum point, but the single most important motivation is that it leads to a robust procedure
elements.2211.03181_699d590dd35d290b78f8ace0e6574: In the next section we review briefly some of the techniques employed for estimating parameters and for directing a PCA in ways which are robust against the presence of outliers
elements.2211.03181_df5a229f20fc8f45650c23533d95a: We also present robustness preliminaries that include some important techniques which are necessary to assess whether the method used is robust or not
elements.2211.03181_a301c38922eab95f28585b07bb8c1: we develop the Cauchy-PCA and theoretically explore its robustness properties
elements.2211.03181_2a471f13c632b36d082dd548b5e0a: we present the numerical algorithms for creating Cauchy PCs, and also give the results of a number of very high-dimensional real-data and simulated examples
elements.2211.03181_1b15971740af0487b54585a685224: Our approach is seen to be competitive with, and often gives superior results to, that of the projection pursuit algorithm of Croux et al. (2007, 2013)
elements.2211.03181_278cea6d35bbe7edfc761a68333f2: Finally we conclude the paper in Section
elements.2211.03181_6a40b41e3f05e6a3ecd36fa21d95b: It is well known that PCA is an important technique for high-dimensional data reduction
elements.2211.03181_4ce00b2563ee1690d551d39c486bc: PCA is based on the sample covariance matrix
elements.2211.03181_93978a9436d2ae368bd147e25bb3e: and it involves searching for a linear combination
elements.2211.03181_7f5a7187d40f4b61fc815e71c62a3: components of the vector that maximize the sample variance of the components of
elements.2211.03181_3b5bc7e68fe00e6057c8d954746db: , the solution will be given by the equation
elements.2211.03181_a728409a18ffa9eace6569e56a5ed: are the corresponding eigenvectors which represent the linear combinations. [[The principal components are efficiently estimated in practice via Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) (cite Lanczos for an efficient algorithm).]] Classical PCA, unfortunately, is non-robust, since it based on the sample covariance or sample correlation matrix which are very sensitive to outlying observations; see section
elements.2211.03181_f00da3a97e83d0fc20789ce14a5cf: However, this problem has been handled by two different methods which result in robust versions of PCA by:
elements.2211.03181_642bc194a1eb9fbdc15c1f045362d: replacing the standard covariance or correlation matrix with a robust estimator; or
elements.2211.03181_4ba593cbbc830839972419e187cf5: maximising (or minimising) a different objective function to obtain a robust PCA.
elements.2211.03181_880ff7f450d3cb9440b0befb1f27c: Many different proposes had been developed to carry out robust PCA, such that using projection pursuit PP,
elements.2211.03181_44c6361968c8b6101a34a2d47cbf5: Despite maximum likelihood estimation, perhaps, being considered as the most important statistical inference method, sometimes this approach can lead to improper results when the underlying assumptions are not satisfied, for instance, when data contain outliers or deviate slightly from the supposed model
elements.2211.03181_5c32dafaddd4e514f070bd83e169e: A generalization of maximum likelihood estimation proposed by
elements.2211.03181_28a1bd4ff7ffdfcd714a76c7f419c: -estimation, aims to produce a robust statistic by constructing approaches that are resistant to deviations from the underline assumptions.
elements.2211.03181_7a0f17c4b32c7ef17eebd48dc14e0: -estimators were also defined for the multivariate case by
elements.2211.03181_ea0d934d3eb84d035830b9adce869: provided a procedure for robust PCA by examining the estimates of means and covariances which are less affected by outlier observations, and by exploring the observations which have a large effect on the estimates
elements.2211.03181_3b8d83eb65533e8471a3c351c3d8f: He replaced the sample covariance sample by an
elements.2211.03181_c294effa3d330b1a0e30de433ffdc: introduced a new approach to create robust PCA
elements.2211.03181_b7cc9b8253201cfab10672cead63b: It combines the advantages of two methods, the first one is based on replacing the covariance or correlation matrix by its robust estimator, while the second one is based on maximizing the objective function for this robust estimate
elements.2211.03181_be09df0ca9b2112280cf70466a947: A robust PCA based on the projection pursuit (PP) method was developed by
elements.2211.03181_28967dddb864c7b7fbaf797cc324b: -estimator of dispersion as the projection index
elements.2211.03181_e084d702219d5ccae136904428aa7: The objective of PP is to seek projections, of the high-dimensional data set onto low-dimensional subspaces, that optimise a function of "interestingness"
elements.2211.03181_7607b11ec82a70597f1d6fa7b774e: The function that should be optimised is called an index or objective function and its choice depends on a feature that the researcher is concerned about
elements.2211.03181_6a6cbc0e69b2f37397e851808dbb7: This property gives the PP technique a flexibility to handle many different statistical problems range from clustering to identifying outliers in a multivariate data set.
elements.2211.03181_9d0101d0c7611b2ad71ee62b4f5c5: characterized the PC's for PP in terms of maximum likelihood under the assumption of normality
elements.2211.03181_bdf136ea66eba22d556c2f112ede1: PCA can be considered as a special case of PP as well as many other methods of multivariate analysis.

elements.2211.03181_a6442922c92ef63b813b3f0436fa6: There are two obvious approaches: one approach, the sequential approach, is to repeat the algorithm described above on the subspace orthogonal to
elements.2211.03181_88dbee18dc8254f0eed4202b2a011: , the second Cauchy principal component, where
elements.2211.03181_90c92d391508f4e50523175f58c7f: is the first Cauchy principal component; then repeat the procedure on the subspace orthogonal to
elements.2211.03181_f5a4affb3b6671c66a22731b60cef: A second approach, the simultaneous approach, is to decide in advance how many principal components we wish to determine,
elements.2211.03181_937b0e3a5eb12dde3e44eae36bc17: It turns out that these two approaches lead to equivalent results in classical (Gaussian) PCA but when a Cauchy likelihood is used the two approaches produce different sets of principal components
elements.2211.03181_d52c3f35e7e5ffc255b248aea386e: Our current thinking is this: the sequential approach is easier to implement (essentially the same software can be used at each step) and it is faster
elements.2211.03181_4ddec1dcdd269d58f7fe44e7687aa: However, the simultaneous approach could potentially be preferable if we know in advance how many principal components we wish to estimate

elements.2211.03181_f1f652d59f87a766662df8b8b2aec: Broadly speaking the effect of the PP PCA does not seem to have been affected substantially by the centering method, i.e. subtraction of the spatial or the column-wise median
elements.2211.03181_1040369a1f3e32a29fea4be4370d1: On the contrary, the Cauchy PCA is affected by the type of median employed to this end
elements.2211.03181_1342d3db33c2e8ee922e1ec1bc399: Centering with the spatial median yields high error levels for all norms of the outliers, for both datasets, whereas centering with the column-wise median produces much lower error levels
elements.2211.03181_2aaa65a830e38713f2d4ba764ea97: On average, the difference in the error between Cauchy PCA and PP PCA is about
elements.2211.03181_d40cade333ee300448050ca279c6e: However, the error of the Cauchy PCA increases and the stabilizes in the GSE31159 dataset whereas the error of the PP PCA is stable regardless of the norm of the outliers
elements.2211.03181_047481c403d55d6b3b6adadc088c2: A different conclusion is extracted in the GSE31161 where the error of either method decreases as the norm of the outliers increases, until it reaches a plateau
elements.2211.03181_129acae95b00befb89c49eee4a9a9: With regards to computational efficiency, the PP PCA is not affected by either centering method, whereas Cauchy PCA seems to be affected in the GSE31159 dataset but not in the GSE31161 dataset as seen in Figures
elements.2211.03181_ad9c558b02d270acc7db2a48b2256: Cauchy PCA centered with the column-wise median is, on average, 5 times faster than PP PCA.
elements.2211.03181_ad8a70e4126961dfd0d2a371010c9: The starting point for this paper is the observation that classical PCA can be formulated purely in terms of operations on a Gaussian likelihood
elements.2211.03181_02e4c8577b26c73f883b9af4e0dde: Although this observation is not new, the specifics of this formulation of classical PCA do not appear to be as widely known as might be expected
elements.2211.03181_28768545038d72dbd6433b3ba4f04: The novel idea underlying this paper is to formulate a version of PCA in which a Cauchy likelihood is used instead of a Gaussian likelihood, leading to what we call Cauchy PCA
elements.2211.03181_0a552cc17a6e41e9de74dc9fccbd5: Study of the resulting influence functions shows that Cauchy PCA has very good robustness properties
elements.2211.03181_a359a80d36eb9d429b9d6e2edc856: Moreover, we have provided an implementation of Cauchy PCA which runs quickly and reliably
elements.2211.03181_e2849d4195a835a362d28ef37443c: Numerous simulation and real-data examples, mainly in high-dimensional settings, show that Cauchy PCA typically out-performs alternative robust versions of PCA whose implementation is in the public domain.

\begin{equation*}
\begin{aligned}
&\left[ \bfP_{\hat{\bfu}_F} - \rho (\hat{\bfu}_{F} \bfh^T + \bfh \hat{\bfu}_{F}^T) + O(\rho^2) \right] \cdot
\left[ (1-\epsilon) \int_{\mathbb R^p} \bar{g}_c(\bfx;\hat{\bfu}_{F_{\epsilon,\bfz}}) \bfx dF(\bfx)
+ \epsilon \bar{g}_c(\bfz;\hat{\bfu}_{F_{\epsilon,\bfz}}) \bfz  \right] = 0 \\
\Rightarrow&
\bfP_{\hat{\bfu}_F} \int_{\mathbb R^p} \bar{g}_c(\bfx;\hat{\bfu}_{F_{\epsilon,\bfz}}) \bfx dF(\bfx)
- \rho (\hat{\bfu}_{F} \bfh^T + \bfh \hat{\bfu}_{F}^T) \int_{\mathbb R^p} \bar{g}_c(\bfx;\hat{\bfu}_{F}) \bfx dF(\bfx) + O(\rho^2) \\
&= \epsilon \bfP_{\hat{\bfu}_F} \left[\int_{\mathbb R^p} \bar{g}_c(\bfx;\hat{\bfu}_{F}) \bfx dF(\bfx)
- \bar{g}_c(\bfz;\hat{\bfu}_{F_{\epsilon,\bfz}}) \bfz \right] + O(\epsilon\rho) \\
\Rightarrow&
\rho \bfh \left[ \int_{\mathbb R^p}\bar{g}_{cc}(\bfx; \hat{\bfu}_F) \bfx^T \bfx dF(\bfx)
+ \int_{\mathbb R^p} \bar{g}_c(\bfx;\hat{\bfu}_{F}) \hat{\bfu}_{F}^T \bfx dF(\bfx) \right. \\
&+ \left. \int_{\mathbb R^p}  \bfx \bar{g}_{c\bftheta}(\bfx;\hat{\bfu}_{F}) dF(\bfx)
\left[ \int_{\mathbb R^p} \bar{g}_{\bftheta\bftheta}(\bfx;\hat{\bfu}_{F})dF(\bfx) \right]^{-1} \int_{\mathbb R^p} \bar{g}_{c\bftheta}(\bfx; {\hat{\bfu}_F}) \bfx dF(\bfx) \right] + O(\rho^2) \\
&= \epsilon \bfP_{\hat{\bfu}_F} \left[\int_{\mathbb R^p} \bar{g}_c(\bfx;\hat{\bfu}_{F}) \bfx dF(\bfx)
- \bar{g}_c(\bfz;\hat{\bfu}_{F_{\epsilon,\bfz}}) \bfz \right] + O(\epsilon\rho)
\end{aligned}
\end{equation*}
